intro: Myrsine oligophylla, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Myrsine oligophylla is often found in forest understories and is adapted to the moist, shaded environments of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important component of New Zealand's native flora.
